content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is oscillating on a horizontal surface of negligible friction, as shown in the figure. The spring is ideal, with spring constant <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. When the block reaches the position <math alttext="x sub max" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>max</mi><mo>‚Å°</mo></mrow></msub></mrow></math> , a leftward force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that is external to the block-spring system is applied briefly. Which of the following best describes the effects of this force on the period and amplitude of motion?

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
